page.title: 10Thatching in Ropley
page.content: Jim Coomber is a thatcher who came to tell us about his job.He worked with a master thatcher for 4 years to learn but now he is on his own.Jim likes to use straw for his roofs.He thinks it looks nicer than reed.Norfolk reed is the most expensive - it comes from Austria now.Jim used it to thatch the Old Parsonage Tythe Barn.Jim showed us his tools.Some were very old & some he made himself from simple things like an old chair leg & flat piece of wood with nails in to comb the straw.Straw & reed are sharp and cut you so Jim wears leather kneepads.Hazel pegs are used to keep the bundles of reed or straw on the roof.Jim split some hazel twigs to show us.Jim puts a special pattern on the thatch to show it is his work.Jim has just got married and has bought a house near the shop which he is re-thatching.
